## Vocational Training for Inmates

**Notice ID: 21C80-24-4373926**

The Correctional Service of Canada, CORCAN, Pacific Region is seeking a supplier for vocational training services for inmates.

**Description:**
The Service correctionnel du Canada CORCAN has a requirement to provide vocational training to offenders to aid in their safe reintegration into the community. The training should include two streams, one for the Fraser Valley Area and one for William Head. The supplier will provide a two-day Skid Steer operator certificate course to groups of inmates at Federal Institutions in the province of British Columbia.

**Objectives:**
The objective of this request for standing offer is to provide a series of Skid Steer operator certificate courses to inmates to make them employable in various jobs after release.

**Deliverables:**

* Conduct a Skid Steer Operator for 2 days course
* All related certificates to inmates
* Certified instructors
* WorkSafe BC compliant vehicles, training materials and equipment for courses
* Administration of exams or competency assessments related to the skills for Skid Steer operator
* Ensure all training is accomplished in English.

**Tendering Information:**

* Tender Name: RFSO for Skid Steer Operator - Vocational Training
* Process: The RFSO must comply with the Procurement Regulations. 
* Categories: This procurement is not subject to any trade agreement, this is a sole sourcing approach, with a maximum of one contract (two contracts) awarded for the maximum term under the standing offer contract specified below.

**Contract Information:**
* Period: 31 January 2025
* Initial term: 1 year
* Renewal term: 4 years
* Notice Reference Number: 4373926

**Authority:**
The Authority is Linda Mandeville and contact information is applicable as noted in the contact Information below.

**Evaluation Criteria:**
Documents submitted in bid evaluation will be opened by the opening team or proponent selected by the evaluation team in accordance with the SOR 2012-163. Bid documents will be rejected when the evaluation team cannot identify the  bid dimension.

**Other Policies and Procedures:**
The Crown reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. Procurement Assistance Canada (PAC) offers seminars to businesses interested in learning how to do business with the Government of Canada. The seminars are free.
